user_preference: This should be readable by a 7 year old. Use smooth plain clauses, and express abstract ideas in everyday language that fits the passage.

paragraphs.greek: εἴη μὲν οὖν ἡμῖν ἐκκαθαιρόμενον λόγῳ τὸ μυθῶδες ὑπακοῦσαι καὶ λαβεῖν ἱστορίας ὄψιν, ὅπου δ᾽ ἂν αὐθαδῶς τοῦ πιθανοῦ περιφρονῇ καὶ μὴ δέχηται τὴν πρὸς τὸ εἰκὸς μῖξιν, εὐγνωμόνων ἀκροατῶν δεησόμεθα καὶ πρᾴως τὴν ἀρχαιολογίαν προσδεχομένων.

reference_translations.dryden_clough: May I therefore succeed in purifying fable, making it submit to reason so as to assume the face of history. Where it cannot be reduced to any probable likeness, and refuses to admit any element of the possible, I shall beg my readers to be indulgent to antiquity in its records.
reference_translations.perrin: May I therefore succeed in purifying Fable, making her submit to reason and take on the semblance of History. But where she obstinately disdains to make herself credible, and refuses to admit any element of probability, I shall pray for kindly readers, and such as receive with indulgence the tales of antiquity.

translation_step.observations: a) Plain restatement for 7yo: I hope I can clean up the silly myth parts with smart thinking so they look like true history stories. But if a myth won't mix in anything believable and stays stubborn, I need nice listeners who kindly accept old tales. b) Source-close sketch: May it be for us, purifying the mythical with argument, to obey and take history's sight, where but if it arrogantly scorns the believable and accepts not the mix toward the likely, we shall need good-minded hearers and those mildly receiving the ancient inquiry. c) Candidates: 1. 'I want to wash myths clean with reason till they wear history's face, but where they snub what's likely and shun probable blends, beg indulgent hearers for old lore.' 2. 'Clean myths to history with logic where possible; need patient fans of ancient tales otherwise.' 3. Break syntax: 'Myths should listen to reason and look historical. Stubborn ones get a pass from kind readers who like old stuff.'
translation_step.translation: I hope I can clean up the myths with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever a myth stubbornly ignores what makes sense and refuses to blend in anything believable, I will need kind listeners who patiently welcome the old stories.

judgment_step.overall_judgment: Solid first pass with strong simplicity and flow for young readers, but faithfulness dips from rephrasing the optative wish as personal agency and softening the personification of myth; readability shines but could trim minor abstractions.
judgment_step.strengths: Uses everyday words like 'clean up,' 'stubbornly ignores,' 'blend in' to make abstracts concrete; smooth two-sentence structure with clear contrast; natural modern tone like a kids' story explanation.
judgment_step.issues: First clause shifts source's impersonal optative process ('may the mythical be purified by reason, submit, and take history's look') to active 'I hope I can clean up the myths,' losing the myth-as-agent dynamic; 'clear thinking' abstracts λόγῳ better as plain 'reason'; 'what makes sense' and 'believable' double up on πιθανοῦ/εἰκὸς without crisp merge; 'old stories' flattens ἀρχαιολογίαν's sense of ancient records/lore.
judgment_step.revision_plan: Reword opener to: 'May the myth parts get cleaned by reason, obey it, and look like real history.' Merge second part: 'But where a myth won't mix with anything likely and scorns sense, I'll ask for kind listeners who welcome old tales gently.' Swap 'clear thinking' to 'reason'; 'ignores what makes sense' to 'scorns what's likely'; 'patiently welcome' to 'gently accept' for smoother 7yo flow; ensure myth personified lightly as 'won't mix' without stiffness.

sequential_iterations.translation: I hope I can clean up the myths with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever a myth stubbornly ignores what makes sense and refuses to blend in anything believable, I will need kind listeners who patiently welcome the old stories.

translation_step.observations: a) Plain restatement: I want to clean fairy tale stuff with smart thinking so it looks like true history. But if it won't mix in anything real or likely, I need nice kids who are patient with old stories. b) Source-close: May for us mythical purified-by-reason submit and take-history's-look; but wherever arrogantly-scorns plausible and rejects mix-with-likely, we-beg sensible-hearers who mildly-receive ancient-research. c) Candidates: 'Use reason to scrub myths into history shape. Stubborn ones need easygoing listeners for old lore.' (breaks syntax); 'Clean myths with logic to seem historical; where they shun sense, ask patient audience.'; 'Hope myths obey reason and look real; if not, need kind folks okay with ancient tales.' Prior fixes: Drop personification of myth acting, use direct 'where myths won't...'; keep contrast of hope vs need; plain outcomes like 'look like history' over abstracts.
translation_step.translation: I hope to clean up the myths with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever myths stubbornly reject anything believable and refuse to mix in what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome the ancient tales.

judgment_step.overall_judgment: Very strong for 7yo readability with smooth plain flow and core contrast intact, but minor faithfulness dips from over-personifying myths as active rejectors and synonymizing distinct Greek terms πιθανόν/εἰκός; excellent modernity.
judgment_step.strengths: Smooth two-sentence structure mirrors source contrast perfectly without convolution; everyday verbs like 'clean up', 'reject', 'mix in' make abstracts concrete and 7yo-friendly; 'I hope' naturally conveys optative wish; 'kind listeners who patiently welcome' plainly dignifies εὐγνωμόνων/πρᾴως without bookish tone.
judgment_step.issues: Personifies 'myths' as stubborn agents rejecting/mixing, shifting from source's neuter τὸ μυθῶδες as passive object obeying reason; treats πιθανόν (persuasive/credible) and εἰκὸς (probable/likely) as near-synonyms 'believable/likely' instead of distinct scorn vs. mixture; 'clear thinking' slightly abstract chain vs. plain 'reason'; 'real history' adds 'real' not in source's mere 'appearance'; 'listeners' narrows ἀκροατῶν (hearers broadly).
judgment_step.revision_plan: First sentence: Change to 'I hope reason cleans the myths so they look like history.' to depersonify, use single plain 'reason' for λόγῳ, drop 'real'; Second sentence: Change to 'But where myths won't blend with sensible ideas, I'll need nice hearers who gently accept old stories.' to merge redundant rejection/mixture into one plain outcome 'blend with sensible ideas' covering both πιθανόν/εἰκός distinctly as 'sensible' everyday, use 'hearers' for ἀκροατῶν, 'gently accept' for πρᾴως προσδεχομένων, 'old stories' for ἀρχαιολογίαν; keep 'wherever' as 'where' for 7yo brevity.

sequential_iterations.translation: I hope to clean up the myths with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever myths stubbornly reject anything believable and refuse to mix in what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome the ancient tales.

translation_step.observations: a) Plain restatement for 7yo: I hope to use clear thinking to tidy up the myths so they look like true history. But if some parts won't mix with what's believable, I need nice listeners who patiently like old stories. b) Source-close sketch: May it be for us: mythical purified by reason submits and takes history's appearance; but wherever arrogantly scorns plausible and rejects mix with likely, beg understanding hearers who mildly receive ancient lore. c) Candidates: 1. Clean myths via reason into history-look; need patient crowd for stubborn unbelievable bits. 2. (Break syntax) Wish logic turns fairy tales to facts; for holdouts, hope kind folks enjoy old yarns. 3. Use smarts to fix myths to seem historical; where impossible, ask gentle welcome for ancient tales. Prioritize: drop personification per prior, direct outcomes (purify to look like history; need kind for rest), plain clauses.
translation_step.translation: I hope to use clear thinking to clean up the myths so they look like real history. But wherever they can't be made believable or blended with what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome the ancient stories.

judgment_step.overall_judgment: Excellent progress toward 7yo readability with smooth plain flow and direct everyday phrasing; faithful to core wish-contrast structure but slight looseness in agency of myths and word-for-word precision on 'reason' and 'antiquities'.
judgment_step.strengths: Uses simple clauses like 'I hope to...clean up...so they look like' for smooth readability; everyday words like 'believable' and 'kind listeners' fit 7yo level without cutesy slang; preserves key contrast between purification success and need for indulgence; modern article-like feel with no archaic structure.
judgment_step.issues: Personifies myths as 'they' refusing, adding slight forced agency beyond source's neuter mythical element; 'clear thinking' abstracts λόγῳ (reason/speech) when plainer 'reason' fits; 'ancient stories' softens ἀρχαιολογίαν (ancient lore/investigation) vs refs' 'antiquity records'; 'blended with what's likely' indirect for πρὸς τὸ εἰκὸς μῖξιν when direct 'mix of what's probable' clearer.
judgment_step.revision_plan: Change 'I hope to use clear thinking to clean up the myths so they look like real history' to 'I wish reason could clean the myths and make them look like true history'; replace 'wherever they can't be made believable or blended with what's likely' with 'but where myths stubbornly ignore what's believable and won't mix in anything probable'; update 'kind listeners who patiently welcome the ancient stories' to 'I'll ask for kind hearers who gently accept the old tales'; merge into two plain sentences for flow.

sequential_iterations.translation: I hope to use clear thinking to clean up the myths so they look like real history. But wherever they can't be made believable or blended with what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome the ancient stories.

translation_step.observations: a) Plain restatement for 7yo: I want to clean up the made-up stories with smart talk so they look like true history. But if some won't mix with real possibilities, I need nice listeners who patiently like old tales. b) Source-close: May it be ours, purifying the mythical with discourse, to obey and take history's look; where it arrogantly scorns plausible and rejects mix with likely, need sensible hearers gently welcoming archaeology. c) Candidates: 'Use reason to wash myths into history shape; for stubborn ones, beg kind patience for ancients.' (breaks syntax); 'Clean fables with logic for history face, need indulgent ears elsewhere.'; 'Hope logic turns myths real-looking; ask nice folks for unblendable parts.'
translation_step.translation: I hope to clean up the mythical parts with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever they stubbornly ignore what's believable and won't blend with what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who welcome ancient stories with patience.

judgment_step.overall_judgment: Excellent readability and modernity for a 7-year-old audience with smooth plain clauses; faithfulness is strong on core intent and contrast but slips slightly on impersonal wish structure and collective 'us' by shifting to personal 'I'.
judgment_step.strengths: Uses everyday words like 'clean up', 'stubbornly ignore', 'kind listeners', 'patience' to make abstracts concrete and child-friendly; preserves key contrast between purification success and failure without dropping relations; flows naturally with short clauses like modern storybook.
judgment_step.issues: Shifts source's impersonal optative wish ('may it be for us') to personal 'I hope', losing collective tone; 'mythical parts' and 'they' slightly underplays source's personification of 'the mythical' as submitting/refusing; 'clear thinking' softens precise 'reason/logos' into vaguer everyday term without harm but could be tighter; 'ancient stories' simplifies 'archaeology/antiquity' aptly but risks narrowing to tales vs. records/lore.
judgment_step.revision_plan: Revise opener to 'May we clean up the myths using reason so they look like true history' for faithful wish/collective without losing plainness; change 'clear thinking' to 'reason' or 'good sense' if plainer for kid; tweak 'they stubbornly ignore what's believable' to 'it stubbornly scorns what seems real' to nod to personification; end with 'patient listeners who gently accept old tales' to echo 'gently receive' more directly; merge 'won't blend with what's likely' into 'won't mix in anything likely' for tighter flow.

sequential_iterations.translation: I hope to clean up the mythical parts with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever they stubbornly ignore what's believable and won't blend with what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who welcome ancient stories with patience.

translation_step.observations: Plain restatement for 7yo: I want to clean up the fairy tale parts with smart thinking so they look like true history. But if some parts won't blend with what's possible and stay silly, I need nice people listening who are patient with old stories. Source-close sketch: May we purify mythical with reason, hear/take history's look; but where it arrogantly scorns believable and rejects likely-mix, need understanding hearers gently welcoming antiquity-study. Candidates: (1) Hope to reason myths into history shape; beg patience for unblendable bits. (2) Clean fables via logic to seem factual—else need kind ears for stubborn myths. (3) Break syntax: Myths get scrubbed logical for history face; implore gentle audience when they balk at probability.
translation_step.translation: I hope to clean the storybook parts with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever they won't mix with what's likely and stubbornly stay unbelievable, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome old tales.

judgment_step.overall_judgment: Strong readability for a 7-year-old with smooth plain flow, but faithfulness weakened by shifting impersonal wish to personal 'I hope' and adding 'stay unbelievable' which drifts from source scorn/refusal.
judgment_step.strengths: Uses everyday words like 'storybook parts', 'clear thinking', 'real history', 'kind listeners', 'old tales' fitting 7yo level; two simple clauses flow naturally without convolution; modern casual structure like a kids' book excerpt.
judgment_step.issues: Changes source's collective optative wish ('may it be for us') to personal 'I hope to', losing group voice; 'stubbornly stay unbelievable' adds unforced staying and infers 'unbelievable' not directly in source's 'scorns plausible/refuses probable mix'; 'storybook parts' slightly cutesy vs plain dignified 'make-believe parts'; minor merge drops precise contrast of submission vs arrogant refusal.
judgment_step.revision_plan: Reword opener to 'May we clean the make-believe parts with clear thinking so they look like true history' for faithful plain wish without 'I'; replace 'won't mix with what's likely and stubbornly stay unbelievable' with 'stubbornly ignore what's likely and refuse to blend with it' for direct scorn/refusal; change 'storybook' to 'make-believe' and 'patiently welcome old tales' to 'gently accept old stories' to avoid cutesy while keeping 7yo plain; full: 'May we clean the make-believe parts with clear thinking so they look like true history. But where they stubbornly ignore what's likely and refuse to blend with it, we'll need kind listeners who gently accept old stories.'

sequential_iterations.translation: I hope to clean the storybook parts with clear thinking so they look like real history. But wherever they won't mix with what's likely and stubbornly stay unbelievable, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome old tales.

translation_step.observations: a) Plain restatement for 7yo: I want to use clear thinking to fix the made-up story parts so they seem like real history. But if some parts won't mix with what makes sense and stay too wild, I need nice people listening who are patient with old tales. b) Source-close: May it be ours purifying-mythical with-logic to-hear-and-receive history's-appearance, but wherever arrogantly it-despises persuasive and not-receives mixing-to-likely, of-good-sense hearers we-shall-need and gently receiving the-antiquities. c) Candidates: 1. Hope to wash myths clean with reason for history's look; stubborn unbelievable bits need kind old-tale fans. 2. Clean fanciful stuff via logic to match history, but implausible holdouts require patient ancient-story lovers. 3. Break syntax: Myths get reasoned into history shape. For no-way-believable parts, please indulge old lore kindly.
translation_step.translation: I hope to use clear thinking to clean up the made-up parts so they look like real history. But wherever they stubbornly refuse to blend with what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who welcome old tales with patience.

judgment_step.overall_judgment: Excellent for a 7-year-old audience: highly readable with plain clauses and everyday words that capture the intent without dropping the core contrast. Minor faithfulness tweaks needed for precise nuance on 'reason' and 'ancient records'; slight modernity bump for smoother flow.
judgment_step.strengths: Smooth two-sentence flow with plain clauses; everyday terms like 'clean up made-up parts' and 'kind listeners' make abstracts kid-friendly; preserves wish-contrast-need structure without Greek-shaped phrasing; no abstract chains or calques.
judgment_step.issues: 'Clear thinking' slightly abstracts λόγῳ (reason/logic)—use 'reason' directly; 'what's likely' blurs πιθανόν/εἰκός (probable/credible) nuance vs εἰκὸς (reasonable); 'old tales' softens ἀρχαιολογίαν (ancient inquiries/records) toward cutesy when 'old stories' fits better; 'blend' indirect for μῖξιν (mixing).
judgment_step.revision_plan: Change to: 'I hope to use reason to clean up the mythical parts so they look like real history. But where they stubbornly ignore what's probable and refuse to mix with what makes sense, I'll need kind listeners who patiently welcome old stories.' This swaps 'clear thinking' to 'reason', 'made-up' to 'mythical' (still plain/kid-level), 'what's likely' to split 'probable'/'makes sense', 'old tales' to 'old stories', 'blend' to 'mix'; keeps merge for flow.

sequential_iterations.translation: I hope to use clear thinking to clean up the made-up parts so they look like real history. But wherever they stubbornly refuse to blend with what's likely, I'll need kind listeners who welcome old tales with patience.

final_agent_versions.sequential: I hope we can use clear thinking to fix the myths and make them look like history. But if a myth won't listen to good sense or mix in anything true, we'll need kind people who patiently welcome the old stories.

final_synthesis.final_translation: I hope we can use clear thinking to fix the myths and make them look like history. But if a myth won't listen to good sense or mix in anything true, we'll need kind people who patiently welcome the old stories.
final_synthesis.justification: Simplified 'clean up...with reason' to 'use clear thinking to fix'; rephrased 'stubbornly ignores what makes sense and refuses to blend in anything believable' to 'won't listen to good sense or mix in anything true' for 7yo plain language; kept dignified tone and core contrasts while using direct verbs and everyday words.

polish.notes: Simplified 'clean up...with reason' to 'use clear thinking to fix'; rephrased 'stubbornly ignores what makes sense and refuses to blend in anything believable' to 'won't listen to good sense or mix in anything true' for 7yo plain language; kept dignified tone and core contrasts while using direct verbs and everyday words.

final_translation: I hope we can use clear thinking to fix the myths and make them look like history. But if a myth won't listen to good sense or mix in anything true, we'll need kind people who patiently welcome the old stories.
